page.title: 01Rugby Radio Station
page.content:
Rugby Radio Station was designed and built by engineers of the Wireless Section of the Post Office Engineering Department in the 1920s. Regular transmission began on January 1st when messages were broadcast in morse code. It made history. As well as the G.B.R. call sign it also broadcast the Greenwich Time Signal at certain times of the day.
In war time, both were heard by British vessels from warship to submarine. On January 7th 1927 the telephone service opened to give the first long distance radio telephone service in the world and connected ordinary public telephone users. The tallest radio mast is 820 ft.
